image.altText: Martin Dole 2

props.synopsis: The autopsy into the Aboriginal man's death in custody has been completed, with the police brief of evidence handed to prosecutors to determine whether any charges will be laid.

title.children: Kumanjayi White autopsy completed, brief of evidence handed to prosecutors

image.altText: Security cameras on a pole behind a razor wire fence.

props.synopsis: NT police data show crime rates in the NT are moving in two directions, with violent crime increasing and property crime decreasing.

title.children: Here's what the latest police figures reveal about crime rates in the NT

image.altText: A close up of a snake

props.synopsis: Experts say snake bite victims may not even be aware their lives are in imminent danger after a woman was killed by a snake in Katherine earlier this month.

title.children: Katherine snake bite death sparks warning against complacency

image.altText: Multiple bikes race on a sand track.

props.synopsis: The MXGP championships have returned to Australia for the first time in more than two decades, with the world's best riders descending on Darwin to test their skills in a competition broadcast to more than 100 countries.

title.children: The world's best motocross riders and their bikes descend on Darwin

image.altText: A group of Indigenous people with yellow fabric wrapped around their waists, dancing in the sand.

props.synopsis: Yolŋu children from nine Laynhapuy communities are screaming the Yothu Yindi anthem, Homeland Movement, in a ceremony celebrating the Indigenous elders who claimed back life on their country 50 years ago.

title.children: Celebrating an Indigenous culture that colonisation tried to rip away

image.altText: A large LNG tank sits among mangrove trees, Darwin's skyline is visible in the background

props.synopsis: Secrecy around a major methane leak helped Santos avoid public scrutiny for years. It backfired after a prospective bidder reportedly found out via an ABC News report.

title.children: Secrecy over gas leak backfires as $36b Santos takeover scuttled

image.altText: An exterior photo of Palmerston Regional Hospital which also shows the red entry to the ED.

props.synopsis: Large sections of flooring at the Northern Territory's newest, multi-million-dollar hospital are having to be ripped up and replaced after the facility failed food safety checks.

title.children: Flooring ripped up at the NT's newest multi-million-dollar hospital

image.altText: A white woman, short blonde hair, wearing glasses, white blazer and blue top. Standing in front of blurred green background

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's attorney-general is facing backlash after failing to publicly declare a potential conflict of interest regarding a fatal hit-and-run driver before court.

title.children: Conflict of interest claims over attorney-general's link to hit-run driver

image.altText: The logo for Meta is printed on a white box floating from the ceiling

props.synopsis: From today, Instagram will use AI to detect Australian teenagers who've falsely claimed to be adults by entering a fake date of birth. Follow live.

title.children: Instagram to use AI in attempt to catch teens lying about age

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Instagram will use AI to detect if teens are lying
Michaelia Cash says Albanese is rewarding Hamas by recognising Palestine at UN
Optus alerts were 'perfunctory and inaccurate': ACMA chair

image.altText: An older man and woman sit beside side by side inside with serious facial expressions. The woman holds a small brown dog.

props.synopsis: Older Australians entering the aged care system will have to pay for "non-clinical" services such as showers and help with medication under wide-ranging changes taking effect in November.

title.children: Older Australians to pay up to $50/hour for personal care like showers

image.altText: Erika Kirk holds back tears as she speaks at a microphone in white suit.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says Charlie Kirk was a "martyr to American freedom", while his widow says she forgives his alleged assassin during a memorial to the right-wing activist.

title.children: 'I forgive him': Erika Kirk's emotional statement to husband's alleged assassin

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: RBA delivers upbeat economic assessment to Parliament, but warns about the risks of a Chinese slowdown. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: RBA says the economy is in a cyclical upturn, ASX gains after a record close on Wall Street

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Iron ore prices are on the rise — is it sustainable?
ASX 200 up 0.4%, miners and gold in demand
'Very good position in terms of inflation': RBA

image.altText: Anthony Albanese close up, with Chris Bowen in background.

props.synopsis: The problem with an emissions reduction target is that its mere existence implies it is achievable and that if we do achieve it, we will be fine. The truth is more complex.

title.children: Farmland for forests may be the net zero trade-off

image.altText: A fighter jet flies in the sky with a bit of orange-tinted cloud.

props.synopsis: President Donald Trump says he will defend the Baltic states if Russia intensifies hostilities following Moscow's incursion into Estonia's airspace in recent days.

title.children: Russian military plane in Baltic Sea airspace causes concern

image.altText: Eddie has grey hair and a blue top looks off screen, grey stubble, looks worried, flowers behind him.

props.synopsis: Victorian pensioner Eddie Rushforth says he does not know whether his bowel cancer has returned because he cannot afford the cost of the scans.

title.children: 'Where does a pensioner get $550?' Man goes without cancer scans

image.altText: Matt Denny slips on the ground

props.synopsis: Matt Denny was one discus thrower who ended up slipping and sliding across the Tokyo National Stadium as heavy rain made the discus competition a farce.

title.children: 'Silly at this point': Pundits slam farcical end to discus finals

image.altText: Crystal Beale smiling.

props.synopsis: Ms Beale's body was found in the Brisbane River by a member of the public in the early hours of February 22.

title.children: Former partner charged with murder of mother-of-two Crystal Beale

image.altText: A woman wearing a "no stadium" hat speaks at a microphone

props.synopsis: Senator Jacqui Lambie tells the independents in Tasmania's upper house — who hold the fate of the Macquarie Point stadium in their hands — to "find the courage the premier can't" and stop the project.

title.children: Lambie calls on Tasmanian independents to 'block this stadium'

image.altText: Patrick Cripps kisses the Brownlow Medal on stage

props.synopsis: The AFL's big night is here, as the league's best and fairest player is honoured with the Brownlow Medal. Here is everything you need to know about the big event.

title.children: Brownlow Medal 2025: How to follow, how it works and who might win

image.altText: A young woman wearing black sits in front of a white wall on a couch.

props.synopsis: Every night, thousands of Australian kids are homeless without an adult to look after them.

title.children: This program could be a blueprint for keeping kids off the streets

image.altText: Teenage students solve maths problems in workbooks.

props.synopsis: The Victorian Curriculum and Assessment Authority's leadership team is set to be overhauled after a 2024 exam blunder allowed some students access to exam questions ahead of time.

title.children: Exam authority leadership to be 'reset' in the wake of VCE blunder

image.altText: An AI logo is shown in a conference

props.synopsis: It's estimated 30,000 people are working in the AI industry in Australia, and fanfare is growing with start-ups tapping into billions of dollars of venture capital. Yet there are concerns about hype and a lack of regulation.

title.children: AI is 'coming at us fast'. But what exactly is it being used for right now?

image.altText: A graphic image showing people sitting for a job interview including a robot.

props.synopsis: Whether you’re a student halfway through a degree or a mid-career manager planning the next five years, artificial intelligence (AI) is reshaping lives across the country. If you've been feeling its effects, the ABC want to hear from you.

title.children: Has AI impacted your career or life plans? The ABC wants to hear from you

image.altText: A man in a singlet with a sad expression, shaggy beard, in an office.

props.synopsis: The head of a controversial WA drug rehabilitation service says he will resign so he can speak out against "mass migration".

title.children: Shalom House boss steps down, says he was 'muzzled' on immigration views

image.altText: Eleanor Patterson and Angelina Topic under an umbrella

props.synopsis: Eleanor Patterson did not come away with a medal at the 2025 World Athletics Championships. But by supporting Angelina Topić through a tough moment, she gained so much more.

title.children: How this beautiful moment made up for missing a medal for Aussie star

image.altText: A young man and an older man sit together in sporting stands

props.synopsis: The deal would see TikTok's American assets transferred from China's ByteDance to American owners.

title.children: Lachlan Murdoch involved in possible TikTok deal, Trump says

image.altText: A wind turbine bent over with low white clouds around it, tall grass in the foreground.

props.synopsis: After a wind turbine blade snapped in half during a storm, the NSW Nationals Party has called for a safety audit into the renewable technology.

title.children: Wind turbine blade failure six months after installation 'a big shock'

image.altText: Holly Harris and Jason Chan smile

props.synopsis: Australian pair Holly Harris and Jason Chan finish second at the Skate to Milano event in Beijing to book their spot at the Milan-Cortina Olympic Games in February next year.

title.children: Aussie ice dancers claim Olympic quota spot

image.altText: An adult hand cradles the feet of a baby.

props.synopsis: The race to advance gene editing tech continues, spurred on by starry-eyed Silicon Valley investors, entrepreneurs and even pronatalists. But it is still deeply controversial.

title.children: 'The potential to save trillions': The controversial future of gene editing

image.altText: Schoolies mosh 3

props.synopsis: Beach parties could be off-limits for thousands of schoolies on the Gold Coast this year because of significant erosion brought on by Cyclone Alfred.

title.children: Schoolies beach parties in limbo due to 'unprecedented' Gold Coast erosion

image.altText: Three men in cycling jerseys stand together with medals around their necks.

props.synopsis: Queenslander Jay Vine races to a silver medal in the men's time trial at the world road cycling championships in Rwanda.

title.children: Australia's Vine claims spectacular silver in time trial at cycling world champs

image.altText: GettyImages-2236562847

props.synopsis: Chelsea fans stand and applaud Australian superstar Sam Kerr in her long-awaited return to Kingsmeadow in the WSL.

title.children: Kerr earns standing ovation in long-awaited return to Kingsmeadow

props.synopsis: The new film follows the fictional heavy metal band reuniting for one final gig with cameos from Elton John and Paul McCartney.

title.children: 'Turning it up to eleven': Spinal Tap returns
